decks.notes: This deck revolves around assembling the Allosaurus Combo, using cards like Allosaurus Rider, Eldritch Evolution, and Neoform to search for key creatures like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and Griselbrand. By sacrificing Allosaurus Rider to these spells, you can quickly ramp into powerful threats and overwhelm your opponent. Other cards like Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer help protect your combo pieces and disrupt your opponent's game plan. The deck also includes cards like Planar Genesis and Consign to Memory for additional utility and card advantage.

The main concept is to control the game using the UrzaTron lands and powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Sire of Seven Deaths. Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms provide additional control elements and powerful threats. The deck also includes versatile artifacts like Mind Stone and Expedition Map to ensure consistency. Overall, the strategy revolves around assembling the UrzaTron lands quickly, controlling the board with powerful creatures and spells, and ultimately overwhelming the opponent with high-impact threats and disruptive plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Faithless Looting, Unearth, and Thought Scour to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones. These creatures can then be brought back onto the battlefield using the reanimation spell Persist. The deck also includes control elements like Thoughtseize and Spell Pierce to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures early in the game, creating a quick and efficient win condition.

A fast-paced deck focused on quickly overwhelming opponents with low-cost creatures and burn spells. This deck utilizes cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler to apply early pressure, while also using spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to deal direct damage to the opponent. The deck aims to win the game quickly by consistently attacking and dealing damage, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Violent Urge. Overall, this deck is all about aggression and maintaining a relentless tempo.

This deck focuses on assembling the Colossus Hammer combo as quickly as possible by utilizing Puresteel Paladin and Steelshaper's Gift to equip the hammer onto Cori-Steel Cutter. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful, unblockable attacks that can quickly end the game. Protection cards like Shadowspear and Reprieve ensure the combo pieces stay on the board, while cards like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble provide card advantage and mana acceleration. With an aggressive playstyle and strong synergy between cards, this deck can quickly take control of the game and secure a win.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using cards like Lotus Bloom to generate mana and Goblin Charbelcher to deal damage. The key strategy revolves around using various spells and creatures to control the game until the combo can be assembled and executed. Utilizing cards like Stern Scolding and Suppression Ray to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also having access to counterspells like Disrupting Shoal and Flare of Denial for protection. The deck does not rely on traditional lands, instead using alternative means like Hydroelectric Specimen and Jwari Disruption for mana production.

The main concept of this Ruby Storm deck is to generate mana quickly and efficiently through Ritual spells and Ruby Medallion, while using Ral, Monsoon Mage and Glimpse the Impossible to draw cards and find combo pieces. Past in Flames allows you to recast your spells from the graveyard for added value, and Wrenn's Resolve is used to protect your key pieces from disruption. The deck aims to chain together spells and generate a massive storm count to overwhelm your opponent with a powerful finisher, often leading to a quick victory.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Birthing Ritual and utilizing powerful creatures with flash like Shardless Agent and Ice-Fang Coatl to control the board while applying pressure. By combining aggro elements with Simic colors, it aims to overwhelm opponents with a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, such as Flare of Denial and Sink into Stupor. The inclusion of cards like Endurance and Subtlety provide additional protection and disruption against opposing strategies, making it a versatile and adaptable deck in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures to control the game while ramping up to play powerful threats like Emrakul, the Promised End. The deck utilizes ramp cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to quickly accelerate its mana and establish board presence. Control elements such as Malevolent Rumble and Devourer of Destiny help disrupt opponents' strategies while powerful finishers like Emrakul and Thought-Knot Seer provide a strong win condition. The combination of ramp, control, and powerful Eldrazi threats make this deck a force to be reckoned with in Modern 1 vs 1 matchups.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures coupled with disruptive cards to control the opponent's board and hand. It aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent while denying them resources through hand disruption and removal spells. By combining efficient creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Emperor of Bones with powerful disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, the deck seeks to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent, leading to a swift victory while keeping the opponent on the back foot.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Boggart Trawler, Emperor of Bones, and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The deck also utilizes flicker effects like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to provide value and protect key creatures. Additionally, it includes a mix of removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Solitude to deal with threats efficiently. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and enable powerful plays with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Overlord of the Balemurk.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing a powerful board presence by utilizing efficient creatures such as Territorial Kavu and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, supported by key spells like Leyline of the Guildpact and Lightning Bolt to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also has a strong mana base with a variety of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana production. The inclusion of high-impact cards like Scion of Draco and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury helps to close out games quickly and decisively.

The deck focuses on using disruptive counter spells and various combo pieces to assemble a win condition without relying on traditional lands. By using cards like Disrupting Shoal and Suppression Ray to control the game early, the deck can quickly set up powerful combos like Goblin Charbelcher and Thundertrap Trainer to finish off the opponent. The key strategy is to efficiently disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up your own win condition through powerful spells and creatures, ultimately overwhelming them before they can establish a strong board presence.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures combined with disruptive spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The key strategy involves quickly deploying threats like Emperor of Bones and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, while using cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Flickerwisp and Ephemerate provide additional value by reusing key creatures or disrupting the opponent's strategy further. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's plays while maintaining a strong board presence to close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to generate extra mana and untap lands to quickly ramp into playing Primeval Titan. By using cards like Scapeshift and Urza's Saga, it is able to search for specific lands, allowing for explosive plays. The deck also includes a variety of utility lands and spells to further support the combo strategy. Malevolent Rumble is included as a win condition, dealing massive damage to the opponent's life total once the lands are in place. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful synergies.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays while disrupting opponents with taxing effects, primarily through cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. It aims to control the game's tempo with creatures like Solitude and Flickerwisp, allowing for quick and efficient wins. The deck also utilizes graveyard hate and flicker effects to combat various strategies, making it versatile and adaptable to different matchups. It combines aggressive creature strategies with disruptive elements to outpace opponents and secure victories.
